column1: Having considered the underlying facts, this Court held as  follows:

column2: "An  analysis  of the  relationship  that  existed between  the  parties  reveals
that  as  it  was  purely  a  contractual  one  of commercial  nature,  neither
certiorari nor mandamus will  lie  to  remedy  the  dispute  over the  rights  of

column1: the  parties.  The  purported  breach  of such  rights  (and)

column2: between the  parties,  arise  entirely from  a breach  of contract,  even  if one

column1: of the parties was a statutory or public authority. ,,5
